item.title: Middle of Lawford Road, 15th September
item.description:
Pothole in the middle of Lawford Road near junction with Patshull Place. There is a bollard to warn drivers. It’s been there for two months and is causing inconvenience and safety issues to both drivers and pedestrians.

item.title: Yet more fly tipping ...tyre and black bin bags, 15th September
item.description:
Between 4 and 7am this morning this pile was left in Lawley Road...it seems to be the same individual given the time the stuff tends to be dumped there...

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lawley Road, Brunswick Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: England flags on the whole of Wellington Road., 15th September
item.description:
The whole of Wellington Road is full of England flags on all of the lamp posts. Please take these down now, this is very unfair on those of us that have lamp posts right outside our house windows that have to see it all the time. White supremacy should not be encouraged - I am embarrassed to live here, it is a residential road and these flags are unsolicited.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Wellington Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two Large Upholstered Bags Dumped on Pavement – Wheathill Road, 15th September
item.description:
Two oversized upholstered bags, possibly containing foam or stuffing, have been dumped on the pavement at the same flytipping hotspot on Wheathill Road. One is torn open, spilling contents onto the walkway. This is getting out of hand! The site now sees new flytips almost weekly, and the council’s lack of enforcement is clearly fuelling it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wheathill Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter Collection on Westwood Lane (by A2) – Request for Collection and Clearance, 15th September
item.description:
Dear Bexley Council Team, Yesterday, I, together with a group of volunteers, carried out a litter pick around the street lights on Westwood Lane by the A2. We collected several bags of litter, which are now ready for collection. During the clean-up, we also found a **“Footway Closed”** sign, which we believe may belong to the Council. Could this also be collected, please? In addition, we would like to request the removal of the cut trees and branches currently left behind the litter bags. These are unfortunately encouraging further fly-tipping and rubbish being thrown into the area. Thank you very much for your support and for arranging the collection. Kind regards, Marianna Chernobrivenko

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westwood Lane, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet
